SEARCH
Package org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model

Class Configuration

java.lang.Object
org.thamindu.realtimeticketing.model.Configuration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Configuration extends Object implements Serializable
Represents the configuration settings for the Real-Time Event Ticketing System. This class encapsulates parameters such as total tickets, ticket release rate, customer retrieval rate, and the maximum ticket pool capacity. The configuration can be loaded from or saved to a file for persistence.

Rationale: Encapsulating system settings in a dedicated class allows for easier management, reusability, and separation of concerns. Using JSON for configuration ensures human-readable and modifiable settings.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Configuration

      public Configuration()
      Default constructor. Initializes the configuration with default values, ensuring that the application can start without requiring immediate user input.

      Rationale: Default values are essential for development, testing, and fallback scenarios where no custom configurations are provided.

    • Configuration

      public Configuration(int totalTickets, int ticketReleaseRate, int customerRetrievalRate, int maxTicketCapacity)
      Parameterized constructor for creating a custom configuration.
      Parameters:
      totalTickets - Total number of tickets in the system.
      ticketReleaseRate - Rate at which vendors release tickets.
      customerRetrievalRate - The Rate at which customers retrieve tickets.
      maxTicketCapacity - Maximum capacity of the ticket pool.

      Rationale: Allows initialization with specific values for flexibility and testing various system scenarios.

  • Method Details

    • loadConfiguration

      public static Configuration loadConfiguration() throws IOException
      Loads the configuration from the specified file path.
      Returns:
      the loaded Configuration object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the configuration file cannot be read.

      Rationale: Persistent configurations allow the system to maintain state across sessions and simplify setup for recurring users.

    • saveConfiguration

      public void saveConfiguration()
      Saves the current configuration to the specified file path.
